edu.berkeley.compbio.sequtils.strings
Interface FirstWordProvider

public interface FirstWordProvider

Interface for objects that are able to provide a list of the "first words" associated with a sequence spectrum. The purpose of this is that we may compute a chain of spectra, e.g., computing conditional k-mer probabilities from absolute probabilities, which are in turn based on counts. A spectrum based on conditional probabilities does not fully describe the distribution unless the starting points are also specified. A spectrum may be based on multiple independent sequences (either becaue there are multiple inputs, or because there are unknown symbols in the sequence). Thus, a complete specification of the spectrum requires a list containing the initial word of each segment. This list can be propagated around, or not, depending on whether it is relevant, independent of the rest of the model (e.g., the conditional probabilities).

Version:
$Id: FirstWordProvider.java 406 2009-05-13 20:53:36Z soergel $
Author:
David Soergel

Method Summary
 List<byte[]> getFirstWords(int k)
          Returns a list of all the initial words of length k that are associated with this object.
 

Method Detail

getFirstWords

List<byte[]> getFirstWords(int k)
Returns a list of all the initial words of length k that are associated with this object. A single sequence has only one initial word, of course, but this object may represent a set of sequences, or a sequence with internal interruptions such as unknown symbols, and so may contain a number of initial words.

Parameters:
k - the width of the words to provide.
Returns:
the List
